content.description: Climb up and right through clean red rock clipping 7 bolts to a crux pulling the roof. LowerÂ from a 2 bolt anchor.
content.location: Start right of a tree where the trail meets the rock at a small outcropping/cave. This is currently the first bolted route in the Tan Corridor.

content.description: The Jungle is a retro-bolted sport route at the bottom of the Tan Corridor. Work up a left-facing weakness, breaking through the lower crux and continuing past another on the way to the anchor. Bring a few long runners to reduce drag. This route climbs like many of the devious trad climbs in the Tan Corridor with good protection.
content.location: Currently the second route at the lower TC, the Jungle starts off the outcropping/cave but is best to belay from the base.

content.description:
Begin up a handcrack, carefully climbing past several stacked blocks up and right to the base of a ramp. Work up the ramp going back left passing 3 bolts to where it crosses

The Calling

. Clip two bolts on

The Calling

(the crux), then continue up and left clipping 3 more bolts and enjoying the gator skin, juggy finish. Currently you need a small rack 0.5-2 for the crack start. It is also possible to start left with

The Calling

and finish up Ground Control... for a completely bolted experience.
content.protection: A standard rack to 2" plus 8 bolts to a 2 bolt anchor.
content.location: It is in the middle of the Lower Tan Corridor and climbs off steps up the loose looking flake.

content.description:
Climb up to a triangular ledge and clip your first bolt, and continue up past the short, red face clipping three more bolts before pulling the crux moves. Continue up rampy terrain to a steep, black wall. Pull up and right past two more bolts (

Ground Control...

moves off left) and on up to the final cruxy move below the anchors.
content.location: Midway up lower corridor stairs, start in a shallow seam next to a decomposed stump.

content.description: Start up a left-angling crack/seam system up to a miniature roof, (#1 Camalot and green Alien placement). Step up, clip the bolt, and pull the crux. Continue up and left to a bowling ball ledge halfway up the wall. From here, continue up and back right towards the far right edge of the roof and orange corner system. Continue up the right-facing crack, passing some decomposed rock and another bolt to a 2 bolt anchor.
content.protection: A standard rack to 2" and 4 bolts and a 2 bolt anchor.
content.location:
Start right of a stunted tree at a left-angling crack system. This is 25 feet below the start of the

Dark Knight

.
